meanings.definition: A person who believes in or promotes apocalyptic beliefs or prophecies.
meanings.sent1: The apocalyptists in the village warned of a coming disaster.
meanings.sent2: The apocalyptists gathered to discuss their theories about the end of the world.
meanings.sent3: The apocalyptists organized a potluck to prepare for the apocalypse.
meanings.sent4: The apocalyptists' predictions seemed to hang over the town like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The apocalyptists' fervent beliefs made them stand out in the community.

meanings.definition: The group of individuals who interpret and study apocalyptic literature.
meanings.sent1: In the library, the apocalyptists pored over ancient texts about the end times.
meanings.sent2: The apocalyptists met weekly to analyze prophecies from various sources.
meanings.sent3: The apocalyptists' book club focused exclusively on apocalyptic novels.
meanings.sent4: The apocalyptists' discussions about doom and gloom were surprisingly engaging.
meanings.sent5: The apocalyptists' deep dive into apocalyptic literature fascinated many.

meanings.definition: Those who predict or anticipate catastrophic events or the end of the world.
meanings.sent1: The apocalyptists on the news warned of an impending global crisis.
meanings.sent2: Some apocalyptists claim to have visions of the world's demise.
meanings.sent3: The apocalyptists' doomsday countdown clock was both eerie and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The apocalyptists' dire warnings echoed through the town like a chilling prophecy.
meanings.sent5: The apocalyptists' constant talk of the end times created a sense of urgency.
